summary: This is an email chain from April 2023 between FBI agents discussing an urgent deconfliction request from FinCEN regarding the release of Suspicious Activity Reports (SARs) related to Jeffrey Epstein. The SARs are sought for civil lawsuits against JPMorgan Chase and Deutsche Bank. The FBI's New York office notes the USAO has been withholding information due to a pending appeal in the Ghislaine Maxwell case but does not necessarily object to the release.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Mentioned as the subject of a pending appeal that has caused the USAO to withhold information related to her and Epstein, impacting the release of SARs.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Central figure in the civil lawsuits against banks; the SARs in question relate to financial services provided to him.

persons.name: Seamus
persons.context: Addressed in an email regarding the deconfliction request for SARs related to Epstein.

persons.name: Robert Trivers
persons.context: Listed among names of individuals and entities referenced in the FBI's NY-3027571 investigation, which were reviewed for potential objection to SAR release.

connections.description: Linked in the context of a pending appeal regarding Maxwell that affects the release of information related to Epstein's case.
Trivers is listed among individuals referenced in the FBI's Epstein investigation (NY-3027571), suggesting a documented connection.

events.title: Deadline for FBI deconfliction response
events.description: FinCEN sets a deadline for the FBI to respond with any objections to the release of Epstein-related SARs for civil litigation.

events.title: Civil lawsuits against banks filed
events.description: An unnamed Epstein victim (and a class) sues JPMorgan Chase and Deutsche Bank; the US Virgin Islands separately sues JPMorgan, all related to the banks' provision of financial services to Epstein.

locations: Federal District Court for the SDNY (Southern District of New York)
keyFacts: FinCEN requested FBI deconfliction for releasing Suspicious Activity Reports (SARs) related to Jeffrey Epstein's financial transactions for use in civil lawsuits against JPMorgan Chase and Deutsche Bank.

The USAO had been withholding information related to Ghislaine Maxwell and Jeffrey Epstein due to a pending appeal in Maxwell's case, but the FBI's New York field office indicated no necessary objection to the SAR release.
The civil litigation involves an unnamed Epstein victim (and a class) suing the banks, and the government of the U.S. Virgin Islands separately suing JPMorgan.
The FBI investigation referenced is NY-3027571, and a list of names (including Robert Trivers and entities like Nautilus Inc) was reviewed for potential objections to information release.
A judge indicated he might order the disclosure of the SARs if FinCEN did not authorize it, creating urgency for the deconfliction request.
